# xelon_template (Data Source)

The template data source provides information about an existing Xelon template.

Templates are OS images that can be used to create devices (virtual machines). This data source allows you to look up templates by ID or name, and filter by operating system type and cloud.

## Example Usage

### Using name

```terraform
data "xelon_template" "ubuntu" {
  name = "Ubuntu 22.04 LTS"
}

resource "xelon_device" "web" {
  template_id = data.xelon_template.ubuntu.id
  # ... other configuration
}
```

### Using ID

```terraform
data "xelon_template" "ubuntu" {
  id = "12345"
}
```

### Filter by type

```terraform
data "xelon_template" "ubuntu" {
  name = "Ubuntu 22.04 LTS"
  type = "Linux"
}
```

### Filter by cloud

```terraform
data "xelon_template" "ubuntu" {
  name     = "Ubuntu 22.04 LTS"
  cloud_id = 1
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Optional

- `id` (String) The ID of the template.
- `name` (String) The template name (exact match).
- `cloud_id` (Number) Filter templates by cloud ID. If not specified, searches across all clouds.
- `type` (String) Filter by operating system type. Valid values: `Linux`, `Windows`. This is a client-side filter.

### Read-Only

- `description` (String) The template description.
- `category` (String) The template category.
